titles.title: Forest Resources Conservation and Shortage Relief Amendments Act of 1993
Forest Resources Conservation and Shortage Relief Amendments Act of 1993
Forest Resources Conservation and Shortage Relief Amendments Act of 1993
To amend the Forest Resources Conservation and Shortage Relief Act of 1990 to permit States to adopt timber export programs, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Policy, Trade and Environment.
Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Foreign Agriculture and Hunger.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Specialty Crops and Natural Resources.
Ms. Cantwell moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: House Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands

bill.summary: 6/14/1993--Passed House amended. Forest Resources Conservation and Shortage Relief Amendments Act of 1993 - Amends the Forest Resources Conservation and Shortage Relief Act of 1990 to direct the Secretary of Commerce to: (1) prohibit through 1995 the export of unprocessed timber from State and other public lands, or the purchase of such timber as a substitute for exported private land timber; and (2) administer such prohibitions. Authorizes a State, upon approval of the Secretary, to implement a program in lieu of the Federal one. Establishes civil penalties for violations of this Act.
